RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 56. Claiming Purse 12000. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 13 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: JUST A FLIRT ducked in leaving the gate and made contact with Pinnacle Reef, accelerated to the front approaching the seven sixteenths pole and rated the early pace, raced at the rail on the turn and dug in under steady stretch handling to hold on. ROCKING TO HOME came away sharply with a brief clear lead then gave chase outside, was carried wider through the turn but dug in leaving the turn and finished well widest. TALKING TEDDY chased through the backstretch, raced in range of the lead in the three path on the turn but drifted into the stretch and flattened later yards. SMALL PAW was bumped leaving the gate then gave chase toward the outside, drifted on the turn but ran evenly in the lane. PINNACLE REEF was bumped inward and into Small Paw leaving the gate, gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the three path then flattened in the lane. YDOUHAVETOBESOMEAN gave chase, rounded the turn off the rail and showed little in the lane. NICE BUT NAUGHTY chased inside, raced at the rail on the turn then weakened.

ENTRY.NAME: Just a Flirt
ENTRY.COMMENT: ducked in,bumped break,pace,rail turn,held on driving

ENTRY.NAME: Rocking to Home
ENTRY.COMMENT: sharp break,chased outside,carried out turn,finished well widest

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 55. Claiming Purse 12000. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 13 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: JACKYSINTHECASTLE stalked the earlier pace from the three path, challenged toward the three eighths and took the nod approaching the five sixteenths, raced clear into the far turn and held well under steady handling. I SHALLBE RELEASED rated close inside on the first turn, picked up the chase past the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail and ran evenly to late stretch before flattening stride. APPEALING ROAD raced two deep on the opening turn, gave chase past the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the three path and ran evenly in the lane. GOLDEN SALLY raced off the rail on the first turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn about the five path but showed little in the lane. ODINA rated the pace inside, came under pressure nearing the three eighths pole, was met toward the five sixteenths and faded at the rail on the far turn. QUINCYS WAY saved ground.

ENTRY.NAME: I Shallbe Released
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close inside,chased 3/8,off rail turn,flattened late

ENTRY.NAME: Golden Sally
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail early,chased 3/8,5p far turn,empty lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 75. Claiming Purse 15200. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE JANUARY 13, 2023 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Since January 13 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5 ,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: REDWHITEANDTACOS raced with the early pace two deep, challenged at even terms into the backstretch and dueled from that point, contested at a close disadvantage two deep on the far turn but dug in determinedly to eke out the edge over the game effort of CRUZ IN THE CASTLE, who bobbled leaving the gate but closed to the front past the three quarter pole and moved to the inside to rate the pace, was met at even terms into the backstretch and dueled from that point, contested the edge at the rail on the far turn and dug in gamely before ceding; grudgingly. SALTY SAUL rated close inside, bid nearing the three eighths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn and ran evenly to late stretch before flattening stride. SAX saved early ground then eased out into the backstretch, picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn in the five path and ran evenly in the stretch. MAE SAI PRINCESS raced in the three path the first turn, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail then flattened in the stretch. TIZ MICHELLE'S WAY raced in the four path the first turn then stalked into the backstretch, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn about the four path and weakened in the lane. RED QUEEN became fractious in the gate and rounded the first turn off the rail, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole then weakened off the rail on the far turn. CICI UNIFIED became fractious in the gate and saved ground.

ENTRY.NAME: Sax
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,eased out 1/2,chased 7/16,5p far turn,evenly lane

ENTRY.NAME: Salty Saul
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close inside,bid 3/8,off rail far turn,flattened late

ENTRY.NAME: Red Queen
ENTRY.OWNER: Honoring Luke Stables and Kenworthy John C
ENTRY.COMMENT: fractious gate,off rail 1st turn,chased 7/16,weakened far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Redwhiteandtacos
ENTRY.OWNER: Stormy Stable LLC and Rebstock John

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 69. Claiming Purse 13100. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 13 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. NO WVB CLAUSE.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HE IS BONAFIDE took over nearing the three quarter pole and rated the pace inside, was urged away at the rail on the far turn then steadily handled in the stretch. AMICALOLA FALLS rated close inside on the first turn, started a bid toward the three eighths pole, raced in the five path on the far turn then dueled through the stretch for second. AKINGISALWAYSKING rounded the first turn in the five path, bid leaving the three eighths pole and raced in the five path on the far turn and was outfinished in the stretch duel for second. ADARA rounded the first turn off the rail, gave chase past the seven sixteenths pole then flattened in the lane. SLOE GIN BIZ rounded the first turn in the four path, gave chase from the three eighths pole, raced in the six path of the far turn and showed little in the lane. SCOOTSCOOT stalked from the three path the first turn, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole but weakened off the rail on the far turn. STAVANGER saved ground.

ENTRY.NAME: He Is Bonafide
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace,urged away rail far turn,steady handling lane

ENTRY.NAME: Adara
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail,chased past 7/16,off rail far turn,flattened

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 54. Maiden Claiming Purse 18500. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $10,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ONE CANDY CASTLE engaged in close chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn in the four path and dug in under steady handling to get up the final yards. BOP ZAPPER set a pressured pace and contested the edge nearest the rail on the turn, dug in leaving the turn, was met in the final yards but held on to retain second. CALLISTO'S BRIGADE gave chase through the backstretch, raced in the three path on the turn, eased out leaving the turn and finished well to take third the final strides. WINDSOR'S STAR pressured the pace, raced close in the three path on the turn and ran evenly to late stretch before flattening stride. J. WICK pressured the pace inside, raced close off the rail on the turn and finished well. ALL ROADS TO DENIS chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the three path and showed little in the lane. KING OF LUCK gave chase, rounded the turn near the rail and weakened in the lane. COLONIAL ROAD chased, raced in the six path on the turn and showed little in the lane. JUBA'S MOCHA broke awkwardly and hit the gate, chased the early pace outside then saved ground on the turn. NEEDNOEXPLANATION chased through the backstretch, raced in the five path of the turn and was eased in the stretch.

ENTRY.NAME: J. Wick
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace inside,off rail turn,finished well

ENTRY.NAME: One Candy Castle
ENTRY.COMMENT: close chase,4p turn,dug in lane,up final yards

ENTRY.NAME: Bop Zapper
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,edge rail turn,met final yards,held on 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Windsor's Star
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace,close 3p turn,evenly to late lane,flattened

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 60. Claiming Purse 12000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 13 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. NO WVB CLAUSE.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MY BOSS gave chase, took the nod off the rail approaching the quarter pole, dueled clear into the lane and held on under steady handling. COMIDA COMIDA gave chase and took a brief lead approaching the five sixteenths pole, was met toward the quarter but came back and finished well at the outside flank of the winner. SULTRY SALLY H chased outside, rounded the turn about the six path and finished well while gaining on the top two. AMERICAS WOMAN gave chase, rounded the turn off the rail and ran evenly in the lane. HANNAHS RED RUBY chased through the backstretch, raced in the five path on the turn and ran evenly in the stretch. SPUNKY ZOEY chased, raced in the six path on the turn and finished evenly. TAKE CHARGE LISA came away awkwardly and exchanged contact with MAMA'S EYES, gave chase inside, raced at the rail on the turn then flattened inside the sixteenth pole. The latter exchanged contact with Take Charge Lisa leaving the gate, raced outside through the backstretch then saved ground on the turn. QUEEN OF KANTHAROS set a pressured pace while angling toward the inside, was met approaching the five sixteenths pole, dropped back into the turn and gave way.

ENTRY.NAME: Mama's Eyes
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped break,well back outside,saved ground turn

ENTRY.NAME: My Boss
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased,nod off rail near 1/4,clear 1/8,held on driving

ENTRY.NAME: Queen of Kantharos
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured early pace,met 5/16,weakened rail turn

ENTRY.NAME: Sultry Sally H
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased outside,6p turn,finished well,gaining on top two

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 97. Allowance Purse 34800. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 13 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since May 13 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $25,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PENGUIN POWER chased through the backstretch and raced close in the three path on the turn, dug in for the lead later yards and held on. GOLDEN G gave chase, raced in the four and five paths on the turn, drifted leaving the turn but came back and finished well to take second under the wire. STORM BOARDER (CHI) broke in and made contact with E J's Revenge then closed to the front at the three eighths pole and set a pressured pace, contested even terms two deep on the turn, dug in gamely leaving the turn but was outfinished in later yards. PRIMAL DESTINY had a brief early lead, was met at the three eighths pole and dueled at even terms, raced at the rail on the turn and was outfinished in later yards. GOLDEN KEY chased inside, raced at the rail on the turn and flattened in the lane. E J'S REVENGE was bumped leaving the gate, chased inside and showed little in the lane. MY BLUE EYES was not a factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Primal Destiny
ENTRY.OWNER: Fitzpatrick Francis G and Muldoon William
ENTRY.COMMENT: briefly lead,met 3/8,dueled even terms turn,met late,outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Storm Boarder (CHI)
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke in,bumped,up 3/8,even terms turn,outfinished later yards

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 7F Dirt CR: 65. Claiming Purse 12000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ROCKY DICE settled in the four path the first turn, started a bid approaching the three eighths pole and contested even terms in the three path on the far turn then dug in determinedly to inch clear of HERE AND NOFURTHER, who settled off the pace about the three path, bid nearing the three eighths pole and contested even terms just off the rail on the far turn, dueled close leaving the turn but relented in later yards. MISS YOU AJAX raced off the early pace about the four path, picked up the chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn near the rail and finished well to take third inside the sixteenth pole. HE ROLLS took the lead while tapering to the inside and rated the pace, came under pressure leaving the three eighths pole, gave up the lead toward the quarter but remained close through the far turn before flattening approaching mid-stretch. NIGHT TRAIN WAYNE lunged outward and hit the gate at the break then saved ground, eased out into the backstretch, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the turn about the five path and showed little more. SPECTACULO settled off the pace inside, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole then flattened off the rail on the far turn. EISELE raced off the rail on the opening turn and showed little response through the backstretch. NOTIMELIKEPRESENT settled in the three path the first turn, gave chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole then weakened into the far turn. SOUL PROVIDER stumbled leaving the gate and dropped well back, showed no response leaving the first turn, was eased into the far turn and walked off.

ENTRY.NAME: Here and Nofurther
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace 3p,bid near 3/8,even terms turn,relented later yards

ENTRY.NAME: Notimelikepresent
ENTRY.OWNER: Bone Robert D and Brown Jr Edward J

ENTRY.NAME: Night Train Wayne
ENTRY.COMMENT: lunged,hit gate break,saved ground,chased 7/16,5p turn,empty lane

ENTRY.NAME: Soul Provider
ENTRY.COMMENT: stumbled break,dropped well back,eased far turn,walked off
